title: Space Force preparing for the age of proliferated low Earth orbit satellite networks
summary: Lt. Gen. Miller: Hundreds of satellites to reshape military operations

title: Pentagon greenlights $140 billion ICBM program despite cost overruns
summary: A DoD review identified the command and launch segment as a primary driver of cost growth.

title: Launch Roundup: SpaceX flies more customer payloads and Ariane 6 debuts
summary: As many as four SpaceX Falcon 9 missions and the long-delayed inaugural flight of Ariane 6 make up the roster for this week’s launch schedule. The four SpaceX missions will be split evenly between Starlink and two payloads for other customers.

title: 30 Years Ago: STS-65 Lifts Off
summary: The space shuttle Columbia launches from Pad 39A at NASA’s Kennedy Space Center in Florida on July 8, 1994. This was the second flight of International Microgravity Laboratory (IML-2), carrying more than twice the number of experiments and facilities as IML-1. The crew split into two teams to perform around-the-clock research. More than 80 experiments, […]

title: Nine ventures join first SoCal-UK Space Accelerator
summary: Mandala Space Ventures, a Californian venture studio and incubator, announced July 8 the nine United Kingdom-based startups participating in its UK Space Agency-funded accelerator program this fall.

title: NASA’s Neurodiversity Network Interns Speak at National Space Development Conference
summary: Two high school interns funded by NASA’s Neurodiversity Network (N3) presented their work from Summer 2023 at the recent National Space Society (NSS) International Space Development Conference (ISDC-2024), held in Los Angeles, CA (May 23-26, 2024). Both interns were mentored by Dr. Pascal Lee, Planetary Scientist at the SETI Institute and Chair of the Mars […]

title: Live coverage: SpaceX to launch Turkish satellite on Falcon 9 flight from Cape Canaveral
summary: The spacecraft is Turkey's first home-grown communications satellite. Liftoff from pad 40 at Cape Canaveral Space Force Station is set for 5:21 p.m. EDT (2121 UTC).

title: Ariane 6 Ready for Debut Flight
summary: Ariane 6, the European Space Agency and Arianespace’s next-generation rocket, is ready to perform its maiden flight on July 9, 2024.

title: Happy Birthday, Meatball! NASA’s Iconic Logo Turns 65
summary: On July 15, 2024, NASA’s logo is turning 65. The iconic symbol, known affectionately as “the meatball,” was developed at NASA’s Lewis Research Center in Cleveland (now called NASA Glenn). Employee James Modarelli, who started his career at the center as an artist and technical illustrator, was its chief designer. The red, white, and blue […]

title: NASA Mission to Study Mysteries in the Origin of Solar Radio Waves
summary: NASA’s CubeSat Radio Interferometry Experiment, or CURIE, is scheduled to launch July 9, 2024, to investigate the unresolved origins of radio waves coming from the Sun. Scientists first noticed these radio waves decades ago, and over the years they’ve determined the radio waves come from solar flares and giant eruptions on the Sun called coronal […]
